meanings.definition: The state or condition of occurring or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The simultaneousness of the fireworks and music created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The meeting started with perfect simultaneousness, with everyone arriving at once.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneousness of the twins' birthdays always led to confusion in planning their parties.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneousness of the thunder and lightning made the storm particularly intense.
meanings.sent5: The simultaneousness of the dancers' movements was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.sent1: The professor emphasized the importance of the simultaneousness of events in history.
meanings.sent2: The simultaneousness of the traffic lights turning green caused a smooth flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneousness of the cats meowing and dogs barking was quite a cacophony.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneousness of the colors in the painting gave it a vibrant and dynamic feel.
meanings.sent5: The simultaneousness of the clock ticking and rain falling outside was oddly comforting.

meanings.definition: The act of happening or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The simultaneousness of the announcements confused the audience.
meanings.sent2: The simultaneousness of the arrivals at the airport caused a rush at the baggage claim.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneousness of the birds taking flight startled the picnic-goers.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneousness of the waves crashing against the shore was like a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The simultaneousness of the cheers and applause filled the stadium with energy.
